title: CITY BALLET: D'AMBOISE AND MARTINS PREMIERES
description: AS the perfect introduction to the New York City Ballet's Tchaikovsky Festival, George Balanchine's 1934 masterpiece, ''Serenade,'' embodies the romantic sweep and academic form that Mr. Balanchine fuses so naturally in encounters with the Russian composer.

title: Waterloo Festival Opens With All-American Music
description: The 1981 Waterloo Festival will open July 3 and continue through Aug. 30 with concerts of orchestral, chamber and bluegrass music.

title: Melanie Anne Shorin Wed to Greg Feldman
description: Melanie Anne Shorin, a writer and director of promotional and industrial television shows, was married yesterday to Greg S. Feldman, a law student. Judge Sol Wachtler of State Court of Appeals performed the ceremony at the Harmonie Club.

title: New York, June 2, 1981 To the Editor:$
description: If there is anything apparent from the current suffering, strife and bloodshed in Northern Ireland, it is that the British Government is part of the problem and incapable of effecting a peaceful and just solution. If the Thatcher Government realizes this fact, then outside, neutral international forces might be enlisted, as the United Nations was utilized in the Zimbabwe situation.

title: FRANCE MAY RETURN BASQUE SUSPECT TO SPAIN
description: For the first time since Spain began its transition to democracy, a French court has ruled in favor of extraditing a Spanish Basque accused of assassinations for the Basque separatist organization E.T.A.

title: Sky High
description: The University of Southern California has had many great pole vaulters in its track and field history, including an 18-footer and several 17-footers. This year, however, there were only two on the squad, one of whom did 16-6 and the other 15-6.

title: Belmont Park to Bar Winfield Entries
description: The State Racing and Wagering Board has directed Belmont Park officials not to accept the entries of any horses running in the name of Malcolm Winfield, whose stable includes Proud Appeal, an early favorite for the Kentucky Derby.

title: CONTINENTAL COPPER SHIFT
description: William J. O'Brien, 59, has been appointed president and chief operating officer of Continental Copper and Steel Industries, which manufactures cable, screenings, tool steels and other products, effective July 1.

title: SAVE OUR GLOBAL LINKS
description: To the Editor:

title: PREVIEW FOR INHILCO HEAD
description: Today is a big day for Anton Aigner, the 38-year-old president of Inhilco, a subsidiary of Hilton International that operates the food and beverage facilities at the World Trade Center in New York.

title: Football's $2 Window
description: With the price of being a sports fan on the rise, a $2 price for a ticket to a Big Ten football game seems like a bargain. Most Big Ten tickets cost $10 or more.

title: ALBANY CHIEFS BAR ANY TAX PLAN NOW TO HELP THE M.T.A.
description: The legislative leaders of both parties yesterday rejected the key recommendations of Governor Carey's transit panel for raising money to cover the Metropolitan Transportation Authority's operating deficit.

title: The U.N. Today; June 8, 1981; GENERAL ASSEMBLY
description: High Level Committee on Review of Technical Cooperation Among Devel- oping Countries - 3:15 P.M.

title: WEGERLE HURTS ARM IN DEBUT AS COSMOS DEFEAT CHIEFS BY 2-1
description: The Cosmos struggled against the Atlanta Chiefs and lost their latest acquisition early in the game today, but emerged with a 2-1 North American Soccer League victory before 31,452 at Giants Stadium.

title: 1980-81 Winter Had Near-Record Droughts
description: The Commerce Department reported today that the rain-poor winter of 1980-81 produced many records and near records for the nation.

title: Around the World; Leftists Set Fire to Building To Protest Midway's Return
description: Leftist militants protesting the return of the American aircraft carrier Midway to its home port in Yokosuka set fire to a downtown Government building today, using a homemade flame thrower.

title: Notes On People; Gavin's Plan for Success in Mexico: No Comment
description: He's been on the job only a couple of days now, but John Gavin, the actor-turned-Ambassador to Mexico, seems to have found the secret of diplomatic success: keep your mouth shut.

title: AMID AN INCREASING SENSE OF CRISIS, POLISH PARTY LEADERS CALL A MEETING
description: Amid a sense that Poland is drifting toward crisis once again, the Communist Party Central Committee scheduled a meeting for Tuesday to discuss the situation in the country and prepare for a national party congress.

title: TV: 'THE WINTER'S TALE,' A MOVING, POETIC VERSION
description: ONCE again in the comprehensive BBC series ''The Shakespeare Plays'' on public television, a less-known work proves to be the most successful in a television context. Perhaps, as an audience, we bring too many preconceptions to productions of ''Hamlet'' or ''Romeo and Juliet.'' They are almost intimately familiar, even if only through second-rate and distorting performances. But when television offers a splendid performance of, say, ''Henry VIII,'' we retain the ability to be dazzled, to dispense with stale expectations.

title: Grand Canyon Wins
description: Grand Canyon, led by the six-hit pitching of Jeff Fiechtner, advanced in the double-elimination National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics series last night with a 9-2 victory over Winthrop of South Carolina.

title: By Jim Benagh
description: Sports World Specials Big Hit

title: Fire Disrupts PATH Rail Service
description: A fire on the Conrail bridge over the Hackensack River halted PATH rail service between Journal Square and Newark for about two hours today. Normal service was resumed shortly after the fire was put out at 12:30 P.M., a spokesman said.

title: Red Smith The Way Of a Horse
description: ''= THERE be three things which are too wonderful for me,'' King Solomon confessed. ''Yea, four which I know not: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.''

title: Protest March in Puerto Rico
description: Hundreds of marchers staged a 31-mile hike Friday and yesterday to protest the presence of the United States Navy.

title: Jane H. Sandhaus Bride Of Dr. Jeffrey E. Packer
description: Jane Holly Sandhaus was married yesterday to Dr. Jeffrey Elliott Packer at the Hewlett East Rockaway (L.I.) Jewish Center. The ceremony was performed by Rabbis Tobias Rothenberg and Harold Saperstein, rabbi emeritus of Temple Emanu-El in Lynbrook, L.I.

title: LAWYERS' GROUP SEEKS TO PREVENT ENDING OF U.S. LEGAL AID FOR POOR
description: A New York lawyers' group plans to deliver to every member of Congress tomorrow a 100-page ''brief'' opposing President Reagan's proposal to abolish the Legal Services Corporation, which dispenses Federal funds for legal aid for the poor.

title: O'NEILL FORECASTS LOSS FOR REAGAN TAX PLAN, BUT VIEW IS DISPUTED
description: Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. predicted today that the Democratic House would reject President Reagan's three-year tax-cut package despite what Mr. O'Neill characterized as the ''stealing'' by the President of the ''goodies'' from the Democrats' tax plan.

title: 12 More Arrested in Philippines In an Alleged Plot to Kill Marcos
description: The police arrested 12 more people and charged them with being involved with an alleged plot by Moslem guerrillas to kill President Ferdinand E. Marcos and bomb polling places in the presidential election on June 16, authorities announced today.

title: Agencies Report Account Turnover
description: Friday brought, as it frequently does, a flurry of account changes, and last week it benefited Ally & Gargano and TBWA Advertising. The Ally shop won Comprehensive Accounting, a 30-year-old chain of franchised accounting offices that specialize in small- and mediumsized businesses.

title: Notes On People; Ballet Dancer to Trade Talent for Jail Sentence
description: To free himself from a 30-day sentence on a drunk and disorderly charge, Patrick Bissell, a principal dancer with the American Ballet Theater in New York, will have to dance for charity.

title: Ponderosa Parts From Ad Agency
description: Doyle Dane Bernbach, which just said goodbye to American Airlines and hello to Pan Am, is next going to bid farewell to the Ponderosa System, the Dayton, Ohio, chain of steak restaurants with a current ad budget of $14.1 million.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: THE PAST AND THE FUTURE What impact will Congressional committee hearings on security and terrorism have on the writing community? A group of writers and intellectuals hope to answer that question tonight in a forum, ''Disinformation, Internal Security and the Writer,'' presented by the Freedom to Write Committee and the PEN American Center. The panelists include Arthur Miller, Nat Hentoff, Midge Decter, Victor Navasky, Marcus Raskin and, the moderator, Floyd Abrams

title: ZIA ASSASSINATION REVERBERATES THROUGH SOUTH ASIA
description: Beyond its far-reaching consequences in Bangladesh, the assassination of President Ziaur Rahman has had considerable repercussions all over South Asia.

title: THE DUTY OF AN OPPOSITION
description: George Tierney, an 18th century English Whig, opined that the duty of an opposition was to oppose everthing and to propose nothing. That was pure cynicism. Lord Randolph Spencer Churchill later put forward the more sensible aphorism: ''The duty of an Opposition is to oppose.''

title: Egypt Charges Anti-Sadat Plot
description: An Egyptian Government prosecutor charged today that a former Egyptian Armed Forces Chief of Staff, Lieut. Gen. Saad Eddin el-Shazli, and 18 other Government opponents living in exile had plotted to overthrow President Anwar el-Sadat. The group allegedly received $2.8 million from Libya at Syria's urging. A statement issued by the prosecutor's office said the members of the group would be tried in abstenia.

title: Deborah Cohen Is Bride Of Charles Andrew Karp
description: The marriage of Deborah Sue Cohen to Charles Andrew Karp took place yesterday at the Glen Ridge (N.J.) Women's Club.

title: A VIEW OF ABORTION, WITH SOMETHING TO OFFEND EVERYBODY
description: I feel like saying something about this abortion issue. My credentials as an expert on the subject: None. I am an M.D. and a novelist. I will speak only as a novelist. If I give an opinion as an M.D., it wouldn't interest anybody since, for one thing, any number of doctors have given opinions and who cares about another.

title: MEXICO'S PRESIDENT ARRIVES IN THE U.S. FOR 2 DAYS OF TALKS
description: President Jose Lopez Portillo of Mexico, who arrived in Washington tonight for two days of talks with President Reagan, hopes to narrow Mexico's differences with the United States over Central America and discuss broadening cooperation on such perennial problems as trade and migration.

title: ORIOLES 4, ANGELS 1
description: Dennis Martinez limited California to six hits in helping Baltimore stay one game behind the Yankees, the Eastern Division leaders.

title: POPE ADDRESSES 20,000 AT VATICAN MASS
description: Pope John Paul II, in his first speech in public since he was shot three weeks ago, addressed a crowd of 20,000 people today at a Mass in St. Peter's Basilica.

title: Arizona State Gains College Series Final
description: Bert Martinez and Gib Seibert smashed two-run homers, and Donnie Hill and Ricky Nelson added bases-empty shots today to set a College World Series record and power Arizona State to a 12-3 victory over Texas in a semifinal game of the National Collegiate Athletic Association championship.

title: Reds 2, Expos 0
description: Bruce Berenyi, a rookie, gave up only one hit and allowed only two base runners as the Reds swept the Expos and remained two and a half games behind the Dodgers in the Western Division. Berenyi (5-2), a 26-year-old right-hander, struck out 10 Montreal batters and issued only one walk, to Warren Cromartie leading off the eighth inning.

title: Ferragamo Has A Tough Debut
description: Tom Rozantz, the Hamilton quarterback, engineered two touchdowns today to lead the Tiger Cats to a 27-21 exhibition victory over Montreal in the debut of the Alouettes' Vince Ferragamo.

title: IMPERILED HOPES OF 1,200 BRIGHT STUDENTS
description: To the Editor:

title: PLEASANT COLONY IN GOOD SPIRITS AFTER LOSS
description: After the Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs and the Preakness at Pimlico, both tracks close the next day. When they reopen on Monday, the racing does not command much attention beyond the track's perimeters and the plants are not much heard from for another year. But at Belmont Park, there is life after the Triple Crown and Sunday racing in New York. Both were in full bloom yesterday as 33,710 turned out to watch Bright View Farm's Wistful win the Hempstead Handicap by a head from the favored Chain Bracelet.

title: New Haven Student Dies in Fall
description: A Southern Connecticut State College student apparently fell to his death at West Rock Park here yesterday, the police said. Witnesses told the police they saw the student, Andrew Herr, 21 years old, of Westport, climbing the face of the rock last evening, when he apparently lost his footing, a police spokesman said.

title: Summing Once an Uncontrollable Prospect
description: Summing was the winner of the Belmont Stakes, but Pleasant Colony, a couple of barns away, was still getting all attention yesterday. More people seemed interested in asking Johnny Campo why Pleasant Colony had lost than why Summing had won. Is that any way to treat a horse that has just won a $170,580 purse?

title: INSPECTION DELAY SOUGHT IN JERSEY FOR NEW AUTOS
description: The State Division of Motor Vehicles plans to extend from two years to three the time between required inspections for new cars.

title: REPORTERS MARK D-DAY PLUS 37 YEARS
description: On the late side of midnight, Jack Thompson swirled the Scotch and water in his glass, staring hard into it. He was sober and thoughtful.

title: Rescuing Legal Services
description: Some sunshine is finally peeking through the clouds that have hung over the Federal Legal Services program since February, when President Reagan recommended its abolition. The House Judiciary Committee refuses to go along. It has, instead, approved a slimmer budget and new restrictions that are regrettable but not fatal.

title: New York Political Notes; 3 NEW G.O.P. CHIEFS CITY UNLIKELY TO ALTER STATUS QUO
description: In an unusual turnover of party leadership, three of the five New York City Republican leaders have been elected in the last month - Alfred S. Pantaleone in Brooklyn Thursday evening, State Senator Roy M. Goodman in Manhattan 10 days ago and George M. Hart in Staten Island three week ago. That leaves only State Senator John D. Calandra of the Bronx and City Councilman Jack R. Muratori of Queens as "the old-timers" among the Republican county chairmen.

title: Scots Hold Anti-Nuclear Protest
description: A 21-mile march by about 2,000 people to protest the presence of British and American nuclear submarine bases in the Clyde River basin ended today with a rally in Glasgow. The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament said 30,000 people attended the Glasgow rally, but the police said fewer than 4,000 were present.

title: Market Place; Marketing Cost In Video Field
description: AS the Zenith Radio Corporation and the RCA Corporation begin to compete with the Japanese more effectively through advanced color television sets and recording equipment, the Japanese may be winning an advantage in distribution.

title: Back at Burger King
description: J. Jeffrey Campbell, one-time Dancer Fitzgerald Sample man, who joined Burger King and worked in its advertising department before going into the field to actually run operations, has come back to the hamburger chain's headquarters in Miami, Fla., as executive vice president and director of marketing.

title: Washington Watch; Savings Units' Critical List
description: WASHINGTON THE nation's savings and loan associations, squeezed severely because they are saddled with mortgage portfolios full of old lowrate loans that yield far less than the associations must pay out these days to attract and keep their savings depositors, are the object of much Government concern. The average association is operating in the red and living off accumulated capital.

title: Bhuttos' Detention Extended
description: Pakistan's military Government has extended for 90 days the detention of the widow and daughter of Zulfikar Ali Bhutto, the former Prime Minister, an official of their political party said. Nusrat Bhutto, widow of the former Pakistani leader, and Benazir Bhutto, his daughter, were arrested March 8 in a Government crackdown on the People's Progressive Party after the hijacking of a Pakistani airliner on March 2. Mr. Bhutto was overthrown in a military coup in July 1977 and executed in April 1979.

title: BORG SETS RECORD OF 6 FRENCH TITLES
description: Bjorn Borg became the first player to win the French Open tennis championship six times, defeating Ivan Lendl of Czechoslovakia today, 6-1, 4-6, 6-2, 3-6, 6-1, and thereby dispelling all doubts about his health, his ability or the effects of his old age a day after his 25th birthday.

title: MAREE CAN'T OUTRUN PROBLEMS
description: Sydney Maree is running faster than ever, and has shed the athletic stigma of his South African birth, but people are still creating problems for him. And he can do nothing except watch and wait and hope.

title: ROYALS, WAKING UP, 7-1 VICTORS
description: The Kansas City Royals, defending American League champions who have been a vast disappointment to their fans the first two months of the season, may finally be reviving.

title: Relationships
description: ''H E was a doctor until he became involved with Baba Muktananda five years ago, and then he gave medicine up,'' the concerned father from Brooklyn said, almost inaudibly.

title: Oil Company Tax Rates
description: The 26 largest energy companies paid United States income taxes at an average effective rate of 12.4 percent in 1979, putting them in the same tax bracket as a wage earner making about $20,000, the Energy Department said Friday.

title: Floods Hit 2 Texas Counties
description: Rising flood waters in two southeast Texas counties today forced at least 100 families from their homes, washed out a railroad line and collapsed two dams, the authorities said. There were no reports of injuries, and a Polk County official said some families were refusing to leave their homes because they were afraid of looting.

title: Dr. Audrey U. Smith, a Specialist In Preserving Cells, Is Dead at 66
description: Dr. Audrey U. Smith, who conducted extensive research into cell preservation techniques as an associate of Britain's National Institute for Medical Research, died Wednesday in London, where she lived. She was 66 years old.

title: Blanton Trial Entering 8th Week
description: The trial of former Gov. Ray Blanton of Tennessee and two other men enters its eighth week tomorrow with jurors still trying to reach a verdict. Deliberations began last Wednesday. Mr. Blanton, his 1974 campaign manager, James Allen, and his former special assistant, Clyde Edd Hood Jr., face Federal charges of conspiracy and mail fraud involving liquor licenses awarded in 1978. Mr. Blanton and Mr. Hood also face extortion charges.

title: BRIDGE
description: For those who wish to sharpen their play and defense skills in the privacy of their home, a course of practical problems in which two of the four hands are shown is no doubt best. An example is the diagrammed deal in which South is playing three no-trump. Cover the East-West hands and plan the play after West has led the heart two and East has won with the king and returned the three.

title: 'Who, Me?'
description: It took the testimony of a sage, an oracle, a drunken partygoer, a messenger, a sheepherder and his own wife before Oedipus could figure out who his father was. And until recently a woman seeking to have someone declared her child's father - or to clarify the point for herself - had to rely on similar evidence.

title: NEW XEROX PERSONAL COMPUTER ALSO SERVES AS WORD PROCESSOR
description: The Xerox Corporation today will become the first major American office products company to enter the personal computer market, introducing a machine that can double as a word processor.

title: GREYHOUND LINES OF CANADA LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Mar 31
FRANCE CONDEMNS ATTACK AND REJECTS ISRAELI ACCOUNT
description: France today termed the Israeli air strike against Iraq's French-built nuclear reactor ''unacceptable'' and, taking issue with Israel's official account, said that a French technician had been killed in the raid.

title: PUEBLO INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to May 2
description: Net income for the latest period has been adjusted for the comp change to the LIFO method of inventory valuation

title: Mrs. Lloyd Hurts Knee, May Miss Wimbledon
description: Chris Evert Lloyd, the two-time Wimbledon champion, may miss the tournament because of a torn tendon in her right knee.

title: AFTER VERDICTS IN ABSCAM, LIFE GOES ON
description: Life is not easy these days for Raymond F. Lederer, any more than it is for 10 others who held public office before they were convicted in the investigation known as Abscam. But Mr. Lederer has other things to do now beside brood over a wrecked Congressional career.

title: Stocks Rise as Dow Gains 1.85
description: The stock market ended slightly higher yesterday in moderate trading, aided by improved prices for some of the recently weak precious metal and several blue chip issues.

title: U.S. OFFICIALS SAY IRAQ HAD ABILITY TO MAKE NUCLEAR WEAPON IN 1981
description: State Department and intelligence officials said today they believed that Iraq had acquired enough enriched uranium and sensitive technology to make one nuclear weapon by the end of this year, and several bombs by the mid 1980's.

title: BUSINESS TAX ACCORD IS REPORTED
description: The Reagan Administration and business representatives were reported today to have worked out a compromise on a sharply criticized element of the Administration's revised tax package dealing with depreciation.

title: Garwood's Conviction Is Upheld By Camp Lejuene Commandant
description: The commanding general at Camp Lejeune today upheld the court-martial and sentence of Pfc. Robert R. Garwood of the Marines, who was convicted in February of collaborating with the enemy while a prisoner of war in Vietnam.

title: TIMMERMAN SHOWS THAT 'AUTHORITARIAN GENERALS' ARE KEEPERS, CAPTIVES OF
description: Jacobo Timerman, expelled from Argentina and stripped of his citizenship and most of his property by the military regime, is demonstrating that writing well is the best revenge.

title: MERGER CREATES NO. 1 CANADIAN BROKER
description: Two Toronto investment dealers announced plans today for a merger that will create the largest investment firm in Canada, with a staff of about 1,800, offices in 29 cities and combined revenues of more than $200 million (Canadian).

title: SOCIAL SCIENTISTS CANNOT BE NEUTRAL
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. SAYS AIR STRIKE MAY VIOLATE ACCORD
description: The United States ''condemned'' Israel today for bombing an Iraqi nuclear reactor and said Israel may have violated its aid agreement with Washington by using American-made warplanes in the attack.

title: Us Magazine to Become Weekly in September 1982
description: Us magazine, owned for the last year by Peter Callahan, will double its frequency to weekly in September 1982, its management announced to media professionals yesterday at a luncheon in the St. Regis Hotel.

title: British KMP Partnership Acquired by Compton
description: Compton International has added KMP Partnership, London, a privately held company with $46 million in billings, to its international string of ad agencies. The deal was made for stock and cash, according to O. Milton Gossett, chairman of Compton Advertising.

title: Prenatal Blood Test TO SCIENCE TIMES:
description: Your article on a new maternal blood test for prenatal diagnosis of serious birth defects, ''Simple Test Could Affect Most Expectant Mothers'' (Jan. 13), appears to have given casual readers the false impression that the test is a do-it-yourself kit for home use.

title: ALBERT KING READY AND EAGER TO MAKE OWN NAME IN PROS
description: While Albert King was busy on one telephone in his apartment the other day, another kept ringing. ''Excuse me, that's for my roommate,'' said King. ''At least, I think he's still my roommate. We get a chance to wave at each other now and then. He's big time. Big time.''

title: F.B.I. Agents Wound Fugitive in Hotel Lobby
description: Federal agents yesterday shot and seriously wounded an escaped murderer, Ronald Turney Williams, 38 years old, in the lobby of a Manhattan hotel.

title: PAY LESS DRUG STORES NORTHWEST INC reports earnings for Qtr to Apr 30
KENAI CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Apr 30
MAGNETIC CONTROLS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Apr 30
description: B-Including $307,000 nonrecurring gain from the sale of various patent rights and know-how to Hewlett-Packard
